Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am still seeing script verify errors, but I already know they are form other nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes... I didnt do this peroperly by any means... I just did a search project of `isratify` and `ratifying` and commented out or removed all of it'

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: becasue james told em last night that it was depreciated... and if ratify or isratify is somwhow accidently set, it makes the node bail out of a round..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And my node has always been shite because it keep bailing out of rounds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so I figured that not letting it bail out has to be better

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it might use a bit more system resource... but seriously it already uses nothing but ram, because of what seems like a poor design choice of storing each round in ram for too long.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think to do this properly... you need to start at `dpow_statemachinestart`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: find wher that is called... and follow each function

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and copy that to a new code base

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so you dont ahve all the old crap... but the problem is that how iguana does its RPC calls and stuff is all hidden all over the place... its a miassive undertaking
